text: The 1972 European Super Cup was a football match between the winner of the 1971–72 European Cup and the winner of the 1971–72 European Cup Winners' Cup. The match was proposed by Anton Witkamp of De Telegraaf to decide who was the best club in Europe. ==Match details== ===First leg=== {| style="font-size: 90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 1 Peter McCloy RB 2 Sandy Jardine LB 3 Willie Mathieson CB 4 John Greig (c) CB 5 Derek Johnstone CB 6 Dave Smith RM 7 Alfie Conn CM 8 Tom Forsyth CF 9 Derek Parlane CM 10 Alex MacDonald LM 11 Quinton Young Substitutes: Substitutes: Substitutes: MF 12 Tommy McLean MF 14 Graham Fyfe Manager: Manager: Manager: Jock Wallace Jock Wallace Jock Wallace ===Second leg=== {| style="font-size:90%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" GK 1 Heinz Stuy RB 3 Wim Suurbier CB 12 Horst Blankenburg CB 4 Barry Hulshoff LB 5 Ruud Krol DM 15 Arie Haan CM 9 Gerrie Mühren CM 7 Johan Neeskens RF 8 Sjaak Swart CF 14 Johan Cruyff LF 11 Piet Keizer (c) Substitute: Substitute: Substitute: FW 16 Johnny Rep Manager: Manager: Manager: Ştefan Kovács Ştefan Kovács Ştefan Kovács ==Related pages== *1971–72 European Cup *1971–72 European Cup Winners' Cup *1972–73 Rangers F.C. season *AFC Ajax in European football *Rangers F.C. in European football ==References== ==Other websites== *RSSSF Super Cup 1972
title: 1972 European Super Cup
